lead_paragraph: ICAHN TAKES AIM AT FAMILY DOLLAR  |  The activist investor Carl C. Icahn, who has a long record of aggressively lobbying corporate boards and management, has turned his attention to Family Dollar Stores, the discount retailer in which he holds a 9.39 percent stake, DealBook’s William Alden writes. In a letter to Howard R. Levine, Family Dollar’s chief executive, Mr. Icahn urged the company to self itself “immediately.” He also demanded that three of his representatives be added to Family Dollar’s board. If the company does not cooperate, Mr. Icahn said he plans to go directly to shareholders with an effort to throw out the entire board.

headline.main: Morning Agenda: Icahn Takes Aim at Family Dollar
